name: Acoustic report
description: A report measuring the noise environment for a new development or its effect within a proposed development

name: Affordable housing statement
description: This statement should set out how the development scheme will comply with the local authority’s  affordable housing policy
source: National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF), paras 61-77

name: Air quality assessment (AQA)
description: An assessment of the impact on air quality around the development and during the construction phase
source: National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF), paras 110, 119

name: Arboricultural impact assessment
description: A supporting report from an arboriculturist for any proposed work on trees - providing detail on the conditions of the trees on or next to the development site
synonyms: Arboricultural report;Tree report;Tree survey;Condition of Trees;Arboricultural implication assessment
source: National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF), paras 44, 136, 187, 193

name: Archaeological assessment
description: An evaluation to identify and assess the potential of an area to contain as-yet unrecorded archaeological sites

name: Biodiversity survey and report
description: Information on biodiversity interests and protected species and any possible impacts on them from the development, plus details of any measures proposed to mitigate or compensate for the impacts
source: The Environment Act 2021 National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF), paragraphs 187 - 195 National Planning Practice Guidance (NPPG), under the heading ‘Natural Environment’

name: Community infrastructure levy (CIL) form
description: A form that must be completed to determine whether the development is subject to a CIL payment

name: Condition of Trees
description: Written arboricultural advice
notes: Covers if tree is diseased, at risk of breaking or falling

name: Completed application form
description: The application form that must be completed for all planning applications, including the relevant sections and questions
source: Article 7 Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015 (as amended)and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015 (as amended)

name: Daylight and sunlight assessment
description: An assessment to evaluate the potential impact of a proposed development on the amount of natural light received by surrounding properties

name: Design and access statement
description: A report accompanying and supporting a planning application that explains how a proposed development is a suitable response to the site and its setting, and demonstrates that it can be adequately accessed by prospective users
source: Article 9, Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015 (as amended)

name: Elevation - existing
description: What a building or structure currently looks like from the outside at a scale of 1:50 or 1:100
source: Article 7, Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015 (as amended)

name: Elevation - proposed
description: Showing how the building will look after work has been carried out at a scale of 1:50 or 1:100
source: Article 7, Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015 (as amended)

name: Energy statement
description: A detailed report about how a planned development will meet the energy efficiency standards set by the local planning authority

name: Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA)
notes: Required if the site exceeds certain thresholds or is near sensitive areas re onshore extraction of oil and gas

name: Environmental Statement
description: A statement setting out an assessment of the likely environmental effects of the proposed development - this is only required if the local planning authority deem the application to have environmental impacts after the Environmental Impact Assessment has been assessed
source: National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF), para 44 National Planning Practice Guidance (NPPG), paras 010 (Reference ID: 4-010-20170728), 034 (Reference ID: 4-034-20170728) and 035 (Reference ID: 4-035-20170728) Town and Country Planning (Environmental lmpact Assessment) Regulations 2017
notes: Required by Development relating to the onshore extraction of oil and gas applications

name: Flood risk assessment
description: An assessment of flood risk that needs to be completed if the proposed development is within a flood risk zone to show the potential impacts of the development on flooding and propose mitigation, such as SuDs
source: National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF), paras 44, 161-186

name: Floor plan - existing
description: Floor plans showing the building as it is now, usually at a scale of 1:100, but can be 1:50 if done to maintain consistency from the elevation drawings

name: Floor plan - proposed
description: Floor plans showing the proposed changes to the building, usually at a scale of 1:100, but can be 1:50 if done to maintain consistency from the elevation drawings
source: Article 7, Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015 (as amended)

name: Heritage impact assessment
description: If the site is close to a heritage asset or conservation area a report is needed to assess the effect of the proposed development on the significance of the heritage

name: Heritage statement
description: This statement describes a heritage asset, its significance and the proposed works that are being applied for
source: National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF), paras 202 - 221

name: Hydrocarbon Licence
description: Proof of exploration rights from North Sea Transition Authority (NSTA)

name: Land contamination assessment
description: Report on potential land contamination issues - if contamination is found on site remediation and mitigation proposals will need to be included
source: National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF), paras 196 to 201
notes: Needed if the site is known or suspected to be contaminated.

name: Landscaping plan
description: A plan of a site considering both soft-landscaping (natural elements like flowers, trees, and grass) as well as hard-landscaping (man-made features like lawn furniture, fountains, and sheds)

name: Lighting assessment
description: A lighting assessment is required for all applications that include use of floodlighting or a significant amount of external lighting

name: Location plan
description: A location plan that shows the site outlined clearly in red in relation to the surrounding area, at a scale of 1:1250 or 1:2500, showing at least 2 named roads and surrounding land and buildings. A blue line must be drawn around any other land owned by the applicant close to or adjoining the application site
source: Article 7, Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015 (as amended)

name: Noise and Traffic Assessment
description: Evaluates operational impact on surrounding communities

name: Noise assessment
description: A report that assesses the impact of noise from the proposed development on the surrounding area
source: National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF), paras 187 and 198

name: Site photographs
description: Pictures to show the existing context and condition of the site and surrounding area
source: Section 3A, The Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Regulations 1990

name: Planning statement
description: The statement identifies the context and need for a proposed development, and assesses how the development is in accordance with the relevant national and local policies

name: Roof plan - existing
description: Drawing showing the roof as it is now
source: Article 7, Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) Section 3A, The Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Regulations 1990

name: Roof plan - proposed
description: Drawing showing the proposed changes to the roof
source: Article 7, Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015 (as amended);Section 3A, The Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Regulations 1990

name: Schedule of Works
source: Section 3A, The Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Regulations 1990
notes: required by Camden for all lbc applications

name: Section - existing
description: A plan that shows an existing vertical cut through a building or site, revealing the interior and exterior profiles
source: Article 7, Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015 (as amended)

name: Section - proposed
description: A plan that shows the proposed vertical cut through a building or site, revealing the interior and exterior profiles
source: Article 7, Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015 (as amended)

name: Site plan
description: A site plan that shows the proposed development in relation to the site boundaries and other existing buildings at a scale of 1:200 or 1:500 is advised
source: Article 7, Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015 (as amended)
notes: general requirement. For extraction of oil and gas needs to Needed to show site layout, access, and safety zones

name: Site restoration plan
notes: Required under UK planning conditions to ensure post-production remediation

name: Sketch Plan
description: Often a plan showing the position of the trees listed in an application

name: Statement of community involvement (SCI)
description: Sets out how residents and businesses have been involved in the design and development process of the proposals
source: National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF), para 41

name: Structural damage report
description: A report that relates specifically to the structural condition of the property if it has been affected by nearby trees
notes: Mentioned in "Trees - Addtional information" section of tree works form

name: Subsidence Report
description: A report by an engineer or surveyor describing damage, vegetation, soil, roots, and repair proposals

name: Transport assessment or statement
description: A description and analysis of the existing transport conditions and details of the expected impact of the proposed development on the local transportation system
source: National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF), paras 109 - 114

name: Travel plan
description: A package of actions to encourage safe, healthy and sustainable travel options for a new development
source: National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF), paras 109 - 114

name: Ecology Assessment
description: A document to identify how protection of biodiversity and habitat quality will be achieved and enhanced, where possible.
source: National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF), paras 187 - 195 National Planning Practice Guidance (NPPG), under the heading ‘Natural Environment’

name: Fire statement
description: A report that sets out how the proposal handles the fire safety aspects, including details of fire safety measures, access for firefighting, and evacuation plans.
source: The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure)(England) Order 2015 (as amended)

name: Sustainability statement
description: A report that outlines how the development will meet sustainability objectives, including energy efficiency, water conservation, and waste management.
source: National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF), paras 44 – 45 and 162 to 169

name: Biodiveristy Net Gain Metric
description: A metric used to assess the biodiversity value of a site before and after development, ensuring that the development results in a net gain for biodiversity.
source: The Environment Act 2021 National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF), paragraphs 187 - 195National Planning Practice Guidance (NPPG), under the heading ‘Natural Environment’
